parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Whosoever, whichsoever, whatsoever.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To show forth, prove. From en and deiknuo; to indicate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.
Written. From grapho; inscribed.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The conscience, a persisting notion. From a prolonged form of suneido; co-perception, i.e. Moral consciousness.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Feminine Singular
str2: To bear witness together with. From sun and martureo; to testify jointly, i.e. Corroborate by evidence.

parse: Personal / Reciprocal Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.
Reasoning, thinking; a conception, device. From logizomai; computation, i.e. reasoning.
Meanwhile, afterwards, between. From meta and a form of sun; betwixt; as adjective, intervening, or adjoining.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: To accuse, charge, prosecute. From kategoros; to be a plaintiff, i.e. To charge with some offence.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: To give a defense, defend myself (especially in a law court): it can take an object of what is said in defense.
